definition: son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: You only got to say she was blankly?
sentences.chinese: 照說這姑娘還真是直腸子。

sentences.english: It's my guts sucked into the drain.
sentences.chinese: 是我的腸子給吸進了下水口。

sentences.english: You usually know what he is thinking, because he shoots from the hip.
sentences.chinese: 一般你能知道他在想什麼，因爲他是根直腸子。

sentences.english: And after all this the LORD smote him in his bowels with an incurable disease.
sentences.chinese: 這些事以後，耶和華使約蘭的腸子患不能醫治的病。

sentences.english: U. S. A's tharm is not so long that it will get indigestion when it swallows Iraq.
sentences.chinese: 美國的腸子沒有那麼長，吞進伊拉克，會消化不良。

sentences.english: It will cut your intestines into pieces if you are foolish enough to swallow me.
sentences.chinese: 如果你愚蠢地吞了我，它就會把你的腸子劃成碎片。

sentences.english: It shows a fox being disembowelled by a pack of hounds.
sentences.chinese: 畫面中一隻狐狸正被一羣獵狗撕咬得腸子外流。

sentences.english: No one fainted the first time I read the short story, 'Guts'.
sentences.chinese: 我第一次讀《腸子》這個短篇故事的時候沒人暈倒。

sentences.english: Huahuachangzi not too much, there will be no marriage crisis.
sentences.chinese: 花花腸子不要太多，婚姻就不會有危機。
去蝦殼和蝦背上的腸子。

sentences.english: Picture your gut chakra opening in a slow-motion explosion of sausage-casing small intestine.
sentences.chinese: 想象下你腸子如同裹了腸衣般四處飛散的慢鏡頭。

sentences.english: In all, 67 people have fainted while I've read 'Guts'.
sentences.chinese: 合計有67個人在我讀《腸子》的時候暈倒。

sentences.english: Salts is a medicine that causes movements of the bowels .
sentences.chinese: 瀉鹽是一種促使腸子運動的藥物。

sentences.english: Nancy:I keep fantasizing about strangling him with his own guts.
sentences.chinese: 我不斷想像用他自己的腸子把他勒死。

sentences.english: After all this, the Lord afflicted Jehoram with an incurable disease of the bowels.
sentences.chinese: 這些事以後，耶和華使約蘭的腸子患不能醫治的病。

definition: to wiggle/to squirm/peristalsis (wave movement of gut wall)
at one's wit's end/unable to find a way out
to bring to a conclusion/to settle (a dispute)/to do away with (oneself)/to break off (a relationship)/resolution (of a problem)
friendly advice/words spoken on sb's behalf/a good word/kind words/words that sound fine but are not followed up with actions
to leap and frisk about (idiom); lively/healthy and active
lit. if it's wrong, it's wrong (idiom); to make the best after a mistake/to accept an error and adapt to it/to muddle through
